Class Dashboard

java.lang.Object
MODEL.Dashboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Dashboard extends Object implements Serializable
Class that represents the game dashboard.

  • Constructor Details

    • Dashboard

      public Dashboard(int numberOfPlayers)
      Constructor for Dashboard class.
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - The number of players in the match.

  • Method Details

    • refill

      public void refill(Bag bag)
      Refill the empty playable slots of the dashboard with tiles randomly extracted from the bag.
      Parameters:
      bag - The bag to take from the random slots for the refill.

    • catchAfterRefill

      public void catchAfterRefill()
      Sets the right value of the attribute catchable for all the slots of the dashboard.

    • checkRefill

      public boolean checkRefill()
      Retrieves if is needed a dashboard's refill or not.
      Returns:
      True if there are only non-single tile, False otherwise.

    • adjaciencies

      public int adjaciencies(int x, int y)
      Retrieves the number of the adjacent slots (not grey or black) to the selected one according to its coordinates in the dashboard.
      Parameters:
      x - The index of the dashboard's slot's row to check.
      y - The index of the dashboard's slot's column to check.
      Returns:
      The number of the adjacent slots (not grey or black).

    • getSingleSlot

      public Slot getSingleSlot(int x, int y)
      Retrieves the slot in the selected position of the dashboard according to the coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The index of the dashboard's slot's row to get.
      y - The index of the dashboard's slot's column to get.
      Returns:
      The slot of the dashboard to get.

    • setSingleSlot

      public void setSingleSlot(Slot slot, int x, int y)
      Sets the input slot in the selected position of the dashboard according to the coordinates.
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot to set.
      x - The index of the dashboard's slot's row to set.
      y - The index of the dashboard's slot's column to set.

    • getSide

      public static int getSide()
      Retrieves the side of the matrix that represents the dashboard.
      Returns:
      The side of the matrix that represents the dashboard.
